problems.title: Rotate Array by K Positions
problems.description:
Problem Statement
Given an array of N integers and an integer K, rotate the array to the right by K positions. If K is larger than N, it should still work correctly.

Input Format
First line contains integer N.
Second line contains N space-separated integers.
Third line contains integer K.

Output Format
Print the rotated array with elements separated by space.

Example 1
Input:
7
1 2 3 4 5 6 7
3

Output:
5 6 7 1 2 3 4

Example 2
Input:
5
10 20 30 40 50
7

Output:
40 50 10 20 30

starterCodes.code:
def rotateArray(arr, k):
    # TODO: Return rotated array (right rotation by k)
    return arr

def solve():
    n = int(input().strip())
    arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
    k = int(input().strip())
    result = rotateArray(arr, k)
    print(*result)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    solve()

hintsList: Always do k = k % n first (handles large K)
Best method: Reverse entire array → reverse first (n-k) → reverse last k

problems.title: Find Second Largest Element
problems.description:
Problem Statement
Given an array of N integers, find and return the second largest distinct element. If there is no second largest (all elements same or N < 2), return -1.

Input Format
First line contains integer N.
Second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print a single integer: the second largest element or -1.

Example 1
Input:
6
12 35 1 10 34 1

Output:
34

Example 2
Input:
5
8 8 8 8 8

Output:
-1
hintsList: Single pass: keep track of first and second maximum
Update second only when you find a number < first and > second
